c74object.name: fluid.grid~
c74object.digest: Constrain a 2D DataSet into a Grid.

div.p: Maps a set of 2D points in a fluid.dataset~ to a rectangular grid using a variant of the Jonker-Volgenant algorithm (https://www.gwern.net/docs/statistics/decision/1987-jonker.pdf). It can be useful to obtain compact grid layouts from the output of dimensionality reduction algorithms such as fluid.umap~, fluid.pca~ or fluid.mds~.
This is similar to projects like CloudToGrid (https://github.com/kylemcdonald/CloudToGrid/), RasterFairy (https://github.com/Quasimondo/RasterFairy) or IsoMatch (https://github.com/ohadf/isomatch).

c74object.discussion:
Open the Overview Patch
fluid.grid~ is part of the Fluid Decomposition Toolkit of the FluCoMa project. For more explanations, learning material, and discussions on its musicianly uses, visit flucoma.org.

method.name: reset
method.digest: Return the object to its original state
method.description: Calling reset will change parameter values back to those the object was created with, i.e. any attribute values set in the box will be retained

div.p: Fit the model to a fluid.dataset~ and write the new projected data to a destination FluidDataSet.

ul.li:
sourceDataSet:
Source data, or the DataSet name

destDataSet:
Destination data, or the DataSet name

div.p: The axis to which the extent constraint is applied. The default 0 is horizontal, and 1 is vertical.
The size to which the selected axis will be constrained. The default is 0, which turns the constraints off.

A factor to oversample the destination grid. The default is 1, so the grid has the same number of points as the input. Factors of 2 or more will allow a larger destination grid, which will respect the original shape a little more, but will also be sparser.
Enable warnings to be issued whenever a parameter value is constrained (e.g. clipped)
